title.narrative: CHILD AND SOCIAL PROTECTION SYSTEMS

description.narrative: By end 2017, based on the results of tailored approaches in three regions, key stakeholders at central level (especially the Ministry of Labour and Social Policy and Ministry of Health) ensure that relevant regulatory provisions and budget allocations incorporate effective, culturally sensitive and accessible prevention and protection services for vulnerable and marginalized children, especially children at risk of family separation, children living in institutions and children with disabilities, which contributes to Child Protection â€“ General, Data And Child Protection, Justice For Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, more children from excluded and poor families benefit from equal access to education and protection systems

mailing-address.narrative: 87 A. Doundukov Blvd. Fl.2 Sofia 1504 Bulgaria P.O. Box 801

related-activity.ref: 0570/A0/04/001 EQUITY AND SOCIAL INCLUSION FOR CHILDREN

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end 2017, based on the results of tailored approaches in three regions, key stakeholders at central level (especially theMinistry of Labour and Social Policy and Ministry of Health) ensure that relevant regulatory provisions and budget allocationsincorporate effective, culturally sensitive and accessible prevention and protection services for vulnerable and marginalizedchildren, especially children at risk of family separation, children living in institutions and children with disabilities

description.narrative: Implementation of the up-dated Action Plan on Deinstitutionalization; new evidence generation informed the child care reform; road map for legislative reform of social services; sustainability of family support services; launch of national study on violence against children; local coordination and services for children victims of violence. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: Per year, number of new cases of children aged 0-2 referred to institutional care at national level and in 3 target regions

actual.value: 2017:404 nationally (78% decrease) and 36 in 3 target regions.

title.narrative: : of municipalities in three regions that provide community based and integrated family support services, in accordance with established service methodology
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Justice system complies with the minimum standards laid down in the Beijing Rules of Justice

baseline.value: Bulgarian Justice system complies only partially with Beijing Rules minimum standards

target.value: 2016:New Juvenile Justice Act drafted with minimum standards incorporated

actual.value: 2017:Draft Act on Diversion and Implementation of Educational Measures fully complies with Beijing Rules Process of public discussion completed. Pending submission to the Parliament.

title.narrative: Legislative provisions, developed by the Government, prohibiting the placement of children under 3 in residential care

baseline.value: Legislation prohibiting the placement of children under 3 in residential care is not enacted

target.value: 2017:Legislation prohibiting the placement of children under 3 year in residential care adopted and established functioning assurance mechanism to inform on its implementation.

actual.value: 2017:Legislation prohibiting the placement of children 0-3 years in residential care not adopted, however Government strategy has established a national goal to close all institutions for children below 3 years by 2020.
